subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
Unclear.

{{zh-ref|Pulleyblank (1983)}} suggests a derivation from {{och-l|羊}}. 

{{zh-ref|Schuessler (2007)}} prefers to relate it to {{bor|zh|tbq-pro|*s-klawŋ||to guard; to herd; to tend (cattle); to graze; to be at leisure}}, whence {{cog|bo|སྐྱོང||to guard; to nurture; to keep; to care for}}, {{cog|csh|klóng||to herd; to graze}}, {{cog|my|ကျောင်း||to feed; to tend (cattle)}}; then {{lang|zh|羌}} means "herders". Compare {{och-l|養|to raise; to nourish}}.

{{zh-ref|Beckwith (2009)}} proposes a possible {{bor|zh|ine}} origin; compare {{cog|txb|klank-||to ride; to go by chariot}}.
